results.title: Green light for the traffic of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Igor Scherb and Federal Republic of Germany
results.brief_description: Traffic problems in transport in Germany. Planning for modern transport arteria: phased traffic lights; traffic counter cylinder placed under the road surface to measure traffic density and automatically adjusts traffic light to govern traffic flow. Frankfurt has radar system to regulate traffic lights - the first in Germany. Use of television to watch flow and allows police to intervene in heavily congested areas - mobile radar checks to control traffic - construction of autobahn widening of existing roads.

results.title: Green and gold greats
results.brief_description: This program brings together a fifty year span of Australian sporting splendour including performances of Don Bradman, Dawn Fraser, Heather McKay, Walter Lindrum, Majorie Jackson, Betty Cuthbert, Herb Helliot, Peter Thomson, Les Darcy, Vic Patrick, Merwyn Wood, Lew Hoad, Ken Rosewall and Phar Lap.

results.title: Green
results.brief_description: Surfing set to music - documentary footage of professional male surfers from four locations across the world and featuring some 50 surfers. Heaps of slow-motion short-board action and a few wipeouts just to keep things interesting. Shot in Mexico, Australia, California, and Hawaii by producer/director Matt Wybenga. Some of the surfers featured include: Joel Parkinson, Mick Fanning, Andy Irons, Kelly Slater and Taj Burrow. Music includes artists DJ Shadow, Ziggy Marley, Single Handed and Coal Chamber.

results.title: Great walls make great art
results.brief_description: Great art is one of the world’s most expensive commodities - well out of the reach of most people. This film considers the multimillion dollar art industry which makes available inexpensive paintings according to public tastes and changing fashions in interior design.

results.title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
results.creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services
results.brief_description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Grandfather's mitten
results.brief_description: A puppet animated film with bright music about a family of mice who make their home in a discarded mitten and their succession of new boarders. Provides a lesson in cooperative living.

results.title: Graduated guidance and backward chaining (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 3 : Graduated guidance and backward chaining are procedures that can be used to help retarded students master new behaviours or responses. To understand these procedures the film looks first at response chains, a sequence of stimuli and responses that end with a terminal reinforcer. NB. This tape is on 525 line NTSC.

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): Overcorrection
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 7 : Overcorrection is a punishment procedure in which the misbehaving student is required to overcorrect the environmental effects of his misbehaviour (restitution) and to practice appropriate forms of behaviour in those situations where the misbehaviour commonly occurs (positive practice). NB. This videotape is on 525 line NTSC.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): physical restraint
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 5 : Discusses physical restraint and punishment programs. Teachers must be cautious in designing and implementing them because of their aversive nature. Both physical restraint and punishment have very powerful advantages, but they also have some serious drawbacks NB. This videotape is on 525 line NTSC
